page.title: 17CLUNTON COPPICE
page.content: Although no longer coppiced the essential nature of the Coppice is probably not much changed from years ago. The steep slopes facing north and east are wooded. The original Coppice hill near Clunton is still mixed woodland with it's beautiful colour changes throughout the year. This woodland is to be left undisturbed as a true nature reserve. Wild creatures are the main inhabitants of the coppice. Coppy Lane runs into Clunton Coppice. It is tarmaced for a mile and a half then forks into two lanes, one which comes out at Bush Farm, Clunton, the other climbs diagonally up the hill to emerge at Cwm Lane above Clunton. There are eight dwellings in the Coppice. All are occupied though one is a holiday cottage. Residents have to rely on well water.
